verses.roman:
puṣkare mathurayāṁ ca
dvāravatyāṁ yatātmavān
upoṣya saṁhitām etāṁ
paṭhitvā mucyate bhayāt

synonyms: puṣkare—at the holy place Puṣkara; mathurāyām—at Mathurā; ca—and; dvāravatyām—at Dvārakā; yata-ātma-vān—self-controlled; upoṣya—fasting; saṁhitām—literature; etām—this; paṭhitvā—reciting; mucyate—one becomes freed; bhayāt—from fear.
translation: One who controls his mind, fasts at the holy places Puṣkara, Mathurā or Dvārakā, and studies this scripture will be freed from all fear.
